DataElement.preferredName: Evaluation Diagnostic Specimen Pathology Report Eligibility Determination ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether there are diagnostic specimens, a sample of blood, urine, or other substance used for diagnosing disease, or pathology reports, a description of cells and tissues made by a pathologist based on microscopic evidence used to make a diagnosis of a disease, as part of the act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Evaluation Diagnostic Specimen Pathology Report Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the diagnostic specimen, a sample of blood, urine, or other substance used for diagnosing disease, or pathology report, a description of cells and tissues made by a pathologist based on microscopic evidence used to make a diagnosis of a disease, as part of the act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Characteristic or indicative of (e.g., a disease).:Evaluation; the act of placing value on something.

Concepts.definition: Characteristic or indicative of a condition.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

Property.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:The description of cells and tissues made by a pathologist based on microscopic evidence, and sometimes used to make a diagnosis of a disease.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

A report that provides a description of the gross and microscopic examination of the specimen and is used to make a diagnosis and to determine treatment. It defines which structures and organs of the body are involved by the tumor, verifies the primary site of the cancer and describes the extent to which it has spread.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Availability of diagnostic ma
ReferenceDocuments.description: Availability of diagnostic material (i.e., diagnostic slides confirming locally advanced/metastatic disease and HER2 stained slides) and operative and pathology reports from diagnosis of locally advanced or metastatic breast cancer

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pathology and NGS reports indicating at least 50% clear cell morphology and ARID1A mutation available to be uploaded to Medidata Rave?
